author: gstein
msg: Update the WC schema based on recent learnings.
- remove "absent" notion in favor of a general "presence" which can be
- move changelist and tree_conflict_data to the ACTUAL table, and fold the
changelist name into the table (rather than a separate table to map
- make some columns of BASE_NODE null-able for cases where we don't know
- add a "text_mod" to the ACTUAL table
- change the LOCK table to use a repos_id/repos_relpath pair rather than
(BASE_NODE): add PRESENCE column. make REVNUM, CHANGED_*, and
(ACTUAL_NODE): renamed CHANGELIST_ID to CHANGELIST, accepting the actual
changelist name rather than a mapped id. add TEXT_MOD and
(LOCK): switch from URL to <REPOS_ID, REPOS_RELPATH> for the key
(statement_keys, statements): remove INSERT_CHANGELIST, adjust the sql
(db_actual_node_t): switch changelist_id to just changelist. add
(fetch_working_nodes): don't fetch changelist or tree conflict data
(fetch_catual_nodes): switch to changelist name, and fetch tree conflict
(read_entries): pull conflict data from ACTUAL. set the changelist field
based on what we find in ACTUAL.
(insert_base_node): renumber insert fields. bind "normal" to the
(insert_working_node): do not insert changelist or conflict data
(insert_actual_node): insert changelist name rather than an ID.
(write_entry): simplify changelist handling. put the tree conflict data

author: hwright
msg: Before writing a directory full of entries to the wc database, remove all
existing WORKING and BASE nodes.  These nodes will be overwritten by any
entries to be written, and this allows us to remove any additional orphan
Current number of WC-NG test failures: 330
(entries_write_body): Remove all WORKING and BASE nodes before adding

author: hwright
msg: Tagging release 1.6.0-rc2 with svn_version.h matching tarball.

author: gstein
msg: Continued documentation and slight evolution of wc_db.
removed SWITCHED parameter (let caller make a second API call).

author: cmpilato
msg: Make switch_tests.py 10 stop XPASSing over ra_serf.
(file_dir_file): Add some checks that the switches which succeed
actually make the dirent kind changes they were supposed to.
